Package bn.inference

Class EnumerationInferencer

  • java.lang.Object
    • bn.inference.EnumerationInferencer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Inferencer
    public class EnumerationInferencer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Inferencer
    Implements the depth-first inference by enumeration algorithm for exact inference in Bayesian networks described in AIMA Figure 14.9.

    • Constructor Summary

      Distribution enumerateAsk​(RandomVariable X, Assignment e, BayesianNetwork bn)
      Return the posterior Distribution P(X|e) for RandomVariable X given Assignment e (evidence variables and their values) using the full joint probability distribution encoded in the given BayesianNetwork.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] argv)
                 throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                        org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                        java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Test EnumerationInferencer.

        Usage: 

             java bn.inference.EnumerationInferencer FILE QVAR [EVAR EVAL]*
        The arguments are as follows: first, the XMLBIF file defining the Bayesian Network; second the name of the query variable; and following that the evidence variables and their values (assumed to be Strings) in pairs.

        The example from AIMA 14.4.1 would be run as: 

                       java -cp bin bn.inference.EnumerationInferencer src/bn/examples/aima-alarm.xml B J true M true
        True distribution is approx. <0.284,0.716>.

        The example from AIMA 14.5.1 (Figure 14.12a) would be run as: 

                       java -cp bin bn.inference.EnumerationInferencer src/bn/examples/aima-wet-grass.xml R S true
        True distribution is <0.3,0.7>.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
        org.xml.sax.SAXException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
